sentences: Mis sa toas istud, tule v채lja!
context: The Estonian word 'ilmus' is the third-person singular past tense form of the verb 'ilmuda', which means to emerge, appear, come out, or be revealed. This dictionary definition shows that this verb has multiple related meanings: 1) physically coming out from somewhere (like coming out of a house, forest, or hiding), 2) emerging from difficult situations unharmed, 3) succeeding with plans or attempts, 4) developing into something, 5) managing financially, and 6) becoming revealed or known. The word 'ilmus' specifically refers to when someone or something emerged/appeared in the past.
